solution_line_template: When Carla was waiting on Monday she counted {num_tiles} ceiling tiles and on Tuesday she counted them twice, {num_tiles} ceiling tiles x {tile_counts_tuesday} = <<{num_tiles}*{tile_counts_tuesday}={tile_counted_times}>>{tile_counted_times} times she counted a ceiling tile.

She also counted {num_books} books in the room on Monday and counted them three times in a row on Tuesday, {num_books} books x {book_counts_tuesday} = <<{num_books}*{book_counts_tuesday}={book_counted_times}>>{book_counted_times} times she counted a book.

On Tuesday Carla counted the ceiling tiles {tile_counted_times} times + counted books {book_counted_times} times = <<{tile_counted_times}+{book_counted_times}={total_counted_tuesday}>>{total_counted_tuesday} times Carla counted something on Tuesday.
